triples.evidence: radio-frequency pulse that flips the magnetization vector, M, by a small angle alpha, much less than ninety degrees.

concepts.term: final data form a three-dimensional Fourier transform

evidence: In this method, we extend the basic idea of gradient echo imaging into three spatial dimensions by using two separate phase-encoding gradients and one frequency-encoding gradient.
